title: 820-2915-B Green Light No Fan Spin
message: Green light on charger, battery is present bot not charging. I'm very new to troubleshooting macbook boards and so far I've just been farting around probing voltages & getting nowhere in boardview. Any suggestions on where to start?

title: 820-2915-B Green Light No Fan Spin
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Remove the battery and start process repair.
Do not connect battery, until get correct PPBUS_G3H voltage.

Check diode mode to ground at L7030.
Post basic voltages for U7000; pins 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15 17, 19, 20, 27.
Also check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28; measured on ohm scale, no power.

title: 820-2915-B Green Light No Fan Spin
message:
You have several problems there; try to fix all.

"3(0v)"
Missing ACIN, very important.

"27/28(9.6k ohm)"
Check R7020/21/22 abd their traces.

"1(6v)
------------
 27(0.9v)"
Result of missing ACIN...

title: 820-2915-B Green Light No Fan Spin
message: R7020(0ohm across?) all traces good, 21(2k, Traces good), 22(6.5k, Also good). voltage on that rail starts at 1.4v but falls slowly to around 0.15v.

title: 820-2915-B Green Light No Fan Spin
message: Ok now they are 10 ohm each, finally got a donor board in and replaced them.

title: 820-2915-B Green Light No Fan Spin
message:
Do you correcy get PPBUS_G3H now?
If not, post U7000 voltages again.
Also post actual resistance between pins 27/28.
